title: How to write a letter to my younger brother who is studying in a boarding school informing him about his poor results that our parents have received - Quora

response.answer_text: How do I write a letter to my younger brother who is studying in a boarding school informing him about his poor results that our parents have received? You simply write, “Hey, Bro! I hear that you’re struggling at your boarding school, and it’s affecting your performance. How can I help? Do you want to hang out next weekend? We’ll grab dinner and a movie and maybe talk about what’s happening, anything that’s bothering you, whatever resources you need to be successful, and whatever else I can help with long-distance. I love you!”

This really shouldn't be your job. Your parents should be in charge of dealing with this issue. They should be inquiring whether there are some support services he can get to improve his outcome. Have they asked you to write him? If you must write him, I would say something like "I'm really sorry to hear that you're having trouble in school. Is there some way that I can help?"
